page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
Although much of the land is rough grazing a certain amount has been reseeded to improve its quality. In fact we found one complete valley where a number of acres had been resown earlier this summer.
Some of the hedges, particularly those along the road sides have been allowed to grow tall to protect the fields from the strong westerly winds. However other hedges have been lopped to the ground with only a small amount of pleaching along the top of the soil banks on which they grow.
One or two houses have been bought up by people outside the area and considerably modernised, one with thatch and double glazing. Others have been simply allowed to fall down and are now in ruins.
